dt: {bc}one that performs duties about the person or home of a master or personal employer

et: Middle English {it}servant, sarvaunt{/it} "person serving a master or lord, retainer, attendant," borrowed from Anglo-French, noun derivative from past participle of {it}servir{/it} "to be in attendance on, {et_link|serve:1|serve:1}"
shortdef: one that serves others; especially : one that performs duties about the person or home of a master or personal employer
one bound to service without wages; also : slave

dt: {bc}a member of the administrative staff of an international agency

shortdef: a member of a civil service
a member of the administrative staff of an international agency

dt: {bc}an employee working with another employee under such circumstances that each one if negligent may expose the other to harm which the employer cannot reasonably be expected to guard against or be held legally liable for

shortdef: an employee working with another employee under such circumstances that each one if negligent may expose the other to harm which the employer cannot reasonably be expected to guard against or be held legally liable for

dt: {bc}a person who signs and is bound by indentures to work for another for a specified time especially in return for payment of travel expenses and maintenance

shortdef: a person who signs and is bound by indentures to work for another for a specified time especially in return for payment of travel expenses and maintenance
